citation.article-title: Vagococcus acidifermentans sp. nov., isolated from an acidogenic fermentation bioreactor
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Vagococcus acidifermentans sp. nov.
Vagococcus acidifermentans (a.ci.di.fer.men′tans. N.L. neut. n. acidum acid; N.L. part. adj. fermentans fermenting; N.L. part. adj. acidifermentans fermenting to an acid).
Cells are Gram-staining-positive, facultatively anaerobic, non-spore-forming, non-motile cocci after 3 days on TSA.
Colonies after 3 days on TSA are smooth, white and convex, 0.2 mm in diameter.
Grows well at 15–37 °C (but not at 4 or 42 °C) and at pH 4.0–9.0.
Growth occurs with 0–1.0 % (w/v) NaCl, but not with 2.0 % (w/v) NaCl.
Grows weakly on MRS agar and NA.
Does not reduce nitrate to nitrite.
Indole and H2S is not produced.
Negative for haemolysis and production of arginine dihydrolase, urease and protease (gelatin hydrolysis).
Acid production from sole carbon sources (API 50 CH) and enzyme activities (API ZYM) are listed in Table 1.
C18 : 1ω9c, C16 : 0, summed feature 4 (C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH), C18 : 0, C16 : 1ω9c and C14 : 0 are the major cellular fatty acids (>6 %).
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 44.2 mol% (HPLC).
The type strain, AC-1T ( = KCTC 13418T = LMG 24798T), was isolated from an acidogenic fermentation bioreactor in a food wastewater treatment plant in Naju province, South Korea.
